enigma.core
Interface Environment

public interface Environment

Encapsulates state information about the currently-running application, such as its environment properties and current path. Environment objects are provided by Enigma.getEnvironment().

Author:
Ethan Royael Nicholas (ethan@ethannicholas.com)
Status:
STABLE. No incompatible changes will be made in the future.

Method Summary
 File getCurrentPath()
          Returns the current working directory, according to this Environment.
 Properties getProperties()
          Returns a map of all environment properties
 String getProperty(String key)
          Returns the current value of an environment property.
 void setCurrentPath(File path)
          Changes the current working directory for this Environment.
 void setProperty(String key, String value)
          Sets the current value of an environment property.
 

Method Detail

getCurrentPath

public File getCurrentPath()
Returns the current working directory, according to this Environment. All built-in Enigma services ignore System's user.dir property and pay attention to the current Environment's working directory instead. Changing user.dir is not safe, as some parts of File pay attention to it and some do not, so the Enigma working directory is used instead.

Returns:
the current working directory
See Also:
setCurrentPath(java.io.File)

setCurrentPath

public void setCurrentPath(File path)
Changes the current working directory for this Environment. This has no effect on anything save the value returned by getCurrentPath(). All built-in Enigma services ignore System's user.dir property and pay attention to the current Environment's working directory instead. Changing user.dir is not safe, as some parts of File pay attention to it and some do not, so the Enigma working directory is used instead.

Parameters:
path - the new current working directory

getProperty

public String getProperty(String key)
Returns the current value of an environment property. Environment properties are exactly like the environment variables in other operating systems.

Parameters:
key - the name of the environment property to retrieve
Returns:
the current value of the specified environment property
See Also:
setProperty(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

setProperty

public void setProperty(String key,
                        String value)
Sets the current value of an environment property. Environment properties are exactly like the environment variables in other operating systems.

Parameters:
key - the name of the environment property to retrieve
value - the new value of the specified environment property
See Also:
getProperty(java.lang.String)

getProperties

public Properties getProperties()
Returns a map of all environment properties

Returns:
a map of all environment properties
